• Regional and Online Campus (ROC) Expansion InformationRead more here   

For more than 50 years, the University of La Verne has been meeting the educational needs of students throughout Southern and Central California through its network of regional campuses.

The University of La Verne works with community colleges, the military, businesses, and public agencies to bring career-focused education to those who want it, when they want it. Today, the University of La Verne maintains a presence in Los Angeles, Orange, Kern, and San Bernardino counties, helping students achieve bachelor’s, master’s, and doctoral degrees.

Online Learning

La Verne Online is a top-ranked online school with both bachelor’s and master’s degree programs available through the University of La Verne. Recognized in 2021 by US News & World Report for its bachelor’s programs, bachelor’s business programs, bachelor’s veterans programs, and master’s in business administration, our programs are at the forefront of online education and are taught by the University of La Verne’s experienced faculty in a way that is both flexible and convenient.

Explore Programs
Extended Learning

The Extended Learning program supports La Verne’s commitment to lifelong learning by offering dynamic, innovative, and stimulating continuing education opportunities to individuals intent on expanding their own horizons.

Learn More
Professional Development

Professional Development Courses at the University of La Verne offers over 250 graduate-level, non-degree semester credit courses for teachers seeking salary advancement, recertification, license renewal or personal enrichment. Students may also earn certificates related to curricula content, classroom management, and Teaching Strategies.

View Courses
